alert.note: Alert for Coastal Nueces (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 4:03PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Nueces and central San Patricio Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 403 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Odem, or near Sinton, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Corpus Christi, Sinton, Taft, Odem, St. Paul, Edroy, Annaville, Calallen and Taft Southwest. This includes the following highways... Interstate 37 between mile markers 9 and 23. US Highway 181 between mile markers 614 and 630, and near mile marker 648. US Highway 77 between mile markers 638 and 658. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
